AAOCA: anomalous aortic origin of coronary artery
AAST: American association for the surgery of trauma
ACGME: Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education
ACOAS: anomalous origin of the coronary artery arising from the opposite sinus
AIS: American Spinal Injury Association (ASIA) Impairment Scale
ALCAPA: anomalous left coronary artery from the pulmonary artery
ASP triad: anorectal malformation or congenital anorectal stenosis, sacrococcygeal osseous defect, presacral mass
ASPECTS: Alberta stroke program early CT score
BADASS: biochemical abnormality of doubtful actual sense or significance
BARP: British Association for the Advancement of Radiology and Physiotherapy
BD-IPMN: branch duct type - intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm
BID: twice a day (drug prescriptions, Latin: bis in die)
BI-RADS: breast imaging - reporting and data system
BM: blood sugar (named after Boehringer Mannheim, company who developed the BM test strip)
BPSD: behavioural and psychological symptoms of dementia
c: speed of light in a vacuum
CADASIL: cerebral autosomal dominant arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy
CAIPIRINHA: controlled aliasing in parallel imaging results in higher acceleration (Siemens)
CANVAS: cerebellar ataxia with neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome
CAP: chest-abdomen-pelvis (as in CT scan of CAP)
CARASAL: cathepsin A-related arteriopathy with strokes and leukoencephalopathy
CARASIL: cerebral autosomal recessive arteriopathy with subcortical infarcts and leukoencephalopathy
CAT: computed axial tomography or computer-aided tomography
CBAVD: congenital bilateral absence of vas deferens
CCST: Certificate of Completion of Specialist Training (UK)
CD: cluster of differentiation (immunology, e.g. CD4, CD8, etc.)
CDC: Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (US federal agency)
CD-ROM: compact disc - read only memory disc
CERAB: covered endovascular reconstruction of the aortic bifurcation
CHALICE: children’s head injury algorithm for prediction of clinically important event
CHANTER: cerebellar, hippocampal, and basal nuclei transient oedema with restricted diffusion syndrome
CHILD syndrome: congenital hemidysplasia with ichthyosiform erythroderma and limb defects
CIRSE: Cardiovascular and Interventional Radiology Society of Europe
CLIPPERS: chronic lymphocytic inflammation with pontine perivascular enhancement responsive to steroids
COMARE: Committee on Medical Aspects of Radiation in the Environment (UK)
CREST: calcinosis, Raynaud phenomenon, oesophageal dysmotility, sclerodactyly, telangiectasia
CRISPR: clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats
CTAP: computed tomography of abdomen and pelvis
CTAVN: cystic tumour of the atrioventricular node
CTCA: computed tomography of chest and abdomen
CTCAP: computed tomography of chest, abdomen and pelvis
CTTAP: computed tomography of the thorax, abdomen and pelvis
CUP: cancer of unknown primary (or carcinoma of unknown primary)
D: aspartic acid (single letter amino acid code)
d: deci- (SI unit prefix for a factor of one-tenth)
day one post op, day two post op, etc.
da: deca-  (SI unit prefix for a factor of ten)
DDD: dual pacing, dual sensing and dual response pacemaker mode
DDMFR: Diploma in Dental and Maxillofacial Radiology (UK)
DICOM: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DLCO: diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide
DMRE: Diploma in Medical Radiology and Electrology
DRESS: drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms
DSM: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
DSM-V: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
EARPV: echogenic anterior wall of the right portal vein
EPISTAR: echo planar imaging and signal targeting with alternating radiofrequency
ESGAR: European Society of Gastrointestinal and Abdominal Radiology
e-THRIVE: : enhanced T1W high resolution isotropic volume examination (Philips)
FABER: flexion, abduction, and external rotation manoeuvre
FACR: Fellow of the American College of Radiology
FAMMM: familial atypical multiple mole melanoma syndrome
FAST: focussed assessment with sonography for trauma
FC Rad Diag(SA): Fellowship of the College of Radiologists of South Africa
FCRB: flexor carpi radialis brevis vel profundus
FDA: Food and Drug Administration (a federal agency of United States)
FIESTA: fast imaging employing steady state acquisition
FLAMES: FLAIR-hyperintense lesions in anti-MOG associated encephalitis with seizures
FNMR: Fédération Nationale des Médecins Radiologues (French radiologists' union)
FOSIT: feeling of something in the throat
FRANZCR: Fellow of the Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Radiologists
FRCR: Fellow of the Royal College of Radiologists
FUEL: FLAIR-variable unilateral enhancement of the leptomeninges
G: gram is the preferred modern usage)
GOMER: get out of my emergency room
HANAC syndrome: hereditary angiopathy with nephropathy, aneurysms, and muscle cramps syndrome
HASTE: half-Fourier acquisition single shot turbo spin-echo
HELLP: haemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelets
HFpEF: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
HFrEF: heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
HINTS: Head Impulse, Nystagmus, and Test of Skew (for central vertigo)
HIPAA: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act 1996 (US)
HoLEP: holmium laser enucleation of the prostate
IASLC: International Association for the Study of Lung Cancer
ICRU: International Commission on Radiation Units and Measurements
ICU: intensive care unit (preferred term, synonym for ITU)
IUD: IUCD preferred, to avoid confusing with meaning above)
IVF/ET: in vitro fertilisation and embryo transfer
Kerma: kinetic energy released per unit mass
LBP: low(er) back pain / lumbar back pain
LBSL: leukoencephalopathy with brainstem and spinal cord involvement and lactate elevation
LEOPARD syndrome: lentigines, ECG conduction abnormalities, ocular hyperteloris, pulmonary stenosis, abnormal genitals, retardation of growth, deafness (sensorineural)
LI-RADS: liver imaging reporting and data system
LLETZ: large loop excision of the transformation zone
MBBS: bachelor of medicine and bachelor of surgery
MCG/mcg: microgram (preferred to μg in medical notes)
MDA criteria: MD Anderson criteria for assessing response of bone metastases to treatment
MD-IPMN: main duct type intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm
MELAS: mitochondrial encephalopathy with lactic acidosis and stroke-like episodes
MERRF: myoclonic epilepsy with red ragged fibres
MIDCAB: minimally invasive direct coronary artery bypass
MINOCA: myocardial infarction with non-obstructive coronary arteries
MRCP: member(ship) of the Royal College of Physicians (UK)
MSM: men who have sex with men
NASCET: North American symptomatic carotid endarterectomy trial
NB: nota bene: take special note of "..." (L: note well)
NICE: National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (UK)
NVvR: Nederlandse Vereniging voor Radiologie (Dutch Radiological Association)
ON: take every night (drug prescriptions, Latin: omni nocte)
OPARACHEE: on resonance paramagnetic chemical exchange effect
OPLL: ossification of the posterior longitudinal ligament
OPPT: orientated to person, place, and time
PaCO: : partial pressure of carbon dioxide in the blood
PADMAL: pontine autosomal dominant microangiopathy with leukoencephalopathy
PANDAS: paediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorder associated with a streptococci
PaO: : partial pressure of oxygen in the blood
PEARL: pupils equal and reactive to light
PERCIST: positron emission tomography response criteria in solid tumours
PERLA: pupils equal and reactive to light and accommodation
PESTLE analysis: political, economic, social, technological, legal and environmental
PFO: pissed (UK slang for inebriated), fell over
PICO: patient, problem or population; intervention; comparison, control or comparator; outcome (EBM process)
PIMS-TS: paediatric multisystem inflammatory syndrome temporally associated with SARS-CoV-2
PIOPED: prospective investigation of pulmonary embolism diagnosis
PI-RADS: prostate imaging reporting and data system
PISAPED: prospective investigative study of acute pulmonary embolism diagnosis
PMitCEBO: prednisolone, mitoxantrone, cyclophosphamide, etoposide, bleomycin, Oncovin® (vincristine)
POPUMET: protection of persons undergoing medical examination or treatment (old UK regulations)
PP: on behalf of (signing letters for someone else) (Latin: per procurationem)
PR: P wave to R wave interval on an ECG
PRICE: protection, rest, ice, compression and elevation
PROPELLER: periodically rotated overlapping parallel lines with enhanced reconstruction
QDS: four times a day (drug prescriptions, from Latin
QHS: every night at bedtime (drug prescriptions, from Latin
QRAPMASTER: quantification of relaxation times and proton density by multi-echo acquisition of a saturation-recovery using turbo spin echo readout
Rad: cgs unit of absorbed radiation dose
RANK: receptor activator of nuclear factor-Kappa B
RANZCR: Royal Australian and New Zealand College of Radiologists
RCL: radial collateral ligament complex of the elbow
REBOA: resuscitative endovascular balloon occlusion of the aorta
RECIST: response evaluation criteria in solid tumours
RVCL-S: retinal vasculopathy with cerebral leukoencephalopathy and systemic manifestations
Rx: prescription (originally, and strictly, ℞, shorthand for recipe, in Latin = take thou)
SCCP: small cell carcinoma of the prostate
SCIWORA: spinal cord injury without radiographic abnormality
SCORIF: stimulated cycle oocyte retrieval in [office] fertilisation
SDASH: shunt-dependency in symptomatic aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage score
SHORT syndrome: short stature, hyperextensibility and/or inguinal hernia, ocular depression, Rieger anomaly, teething delay
SIADH: syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion
SICRET: small infarctions of cochlear, retinal and encephalic tissue
SIRVA: shoulder injury related to vaccine administration
SMART: stroke-like migraine attacks after radiation therapy syndrome
SPACE: sampling perfection with application optimised contrasts using different flip angle evolution (Siemens)
SREAT: steroid responsive encephalopathy associated with autoimmune thyroiditis
STAMCA: superficial temporal artery to middle cerebral artery anastomosis
STUMP: stromal tumour of uncertain malignant potential
SUL: standardised uptake value corrected for lean body mass
T: SI unit of magnetic flux density)
TAFRO: thrombocytopenia, anasarca, fever, reticulin fibrosis and organomegaly syndrome
TAHBSO: total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy
TDS: three times a day (drug prescriptions, L
TGA: Therapeutic Goods Administration (Australian equivalent of the FDA)
THRIVE: T1W high resolution isotropic volume examination (Philips)
TIPIC: transient perivascular inflammation of the carotid artery
TI-RADS: thyroid image reporting and data system
TOLAC: trial of labour after caesarean section
TORCH: toxoplasmosis, other (syphilis, varicella, parvovirus), rubella, CMV, herpes
TrueFISP: true fast imaging with steady state precession
TRUFI: true fast imaging with steady state precession
TT-TG: tibial tuberosity - trochlear groove sulcus distance
TurboGRASS: turbo gradient recalled acquisition in steady-state
VA: Department of Veterans Affairs (Federal agency of USA)
VACTERL: vertebral, anal, cardiac, tracheoesophageal, renal, limb defects
VISTA: volume isotropic turbo spin echo acquisition (Philips)
V1: ophthalmic nerve, first division of the
V2: maxillary nerve, second division of the
V3: mandibular nerve, third division of the
WAGR: Wilms tumour, aniridia, genitourinary anomalies, retardation
WSW: women who have sex with women
